intro: Croton sidifolius, commonly known as the swordleaf croton, is a shrub native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive, sword-shaped leaves that are typically bright green and glossy. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers followed by orange or red fruits that contain three seeds each. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and as a houseplant.
